title: Natural Service Protocols
description: A multi-disciplinary group formed by Research and Extension faculty members from Universities across the U.S. with a focus on beef cattle reproduction, management and reproductive technologies.
cleaned_text: ARSBC Dahlen Proceedings](https://beefrepro.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/2012ARSBC_10DahlenProceedings.pdf) Protocols with less synchrony of estrus are recommended for natural service (NS). Use experienced, 2+ years old bulls that have passed a breeding soundness exam. All protocols for heat detection can also be used with natural service, however a 1:25 bull to cow ratio is recommended. | | COWS | HEIFERS Aervoe, AIPAint, intended to promote sustainable food production systems by the beef industry through sound reproductive management practices for replacement heifers and postpartum cows. The Beef Reproduction Task Force recommends working with a licensed veterinarian for proper use and application of all reproductive hormones.
